etymology.description: semantic 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") + phonetic 㚇(㚇) (zōng, "phonetic component") = rice wrapped in leaves -> sticky rice wrapped in leaves
etymology.interpretation: 糉(糉) (zòng, "sticky rice wrapped in leaves") uses 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") to signify the core ingredient, while the phonetic 㚇(㚇) (zōng) provides the pronunciation. This blending suggests a dish primarily composed of rice, matching its modern culinary context.

examples.chinese: 端午节期间(端午節期間)，家家户户都会吃粽(家家戶戶都會吃粽)。
examples.pinyin: Duānwǔ jié qījiān, jiājiāhùhù dōu huì chī zòng.
examples.english: During the Dragon Boat Festival, every household eats sticky rice wrapped in leaves.

examples.chinese: 我最喜欢吃粽(我最喜歡吃粽)，因为它软糯可口(因爲它軟糯可口)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì xǐhuan chī zòng, yīnwèi tā ruǎnnuò kěkǒu.
examples.english: I like eating sticky rice wrapped in leaves the most because it is soft, glutinous, and delicious.
